column4: has anyone had any right click mouse issue in ubuntu 10.10 ?.. (and any ideas how to solve it).
what's the issue.

i am not able to right click on desktop or folders etc, i have tried -q on nautilus and addins show_desktop to true but notting seems to be working, so i'm leaning into beliving the issue is with the mouse sessting's, i realy don't know what the problem is.
and you've confirmed that this mouse's right click works outside of ubuntu yes?
yes.
did your install start like this, or is this a new thing?
and does the right click work in other programs, like the sudoku game or whatever?
have you tried a different mouse with ubuntu?
it's a built in one i am on a netbook.
okay, so it's not a mouse, its a touchpad, that's different
it's a tochpad issue. "mousepad"
if the driver it uses is called mousepad do the same thing, sudo rmmod mousepad sudo modprobe mousepad
how can i do something like aplay -l for the mousepad to see what it the driver is called.
just do a lsmod
my computer is a lenovo, ideapad, s10-3t. (it's a touch screen enabled as well)..
some touchpads use proprietary drivers, and this is not so fun =\
but i did not have this problem in 10.04 so what did they change :S? if i could know what they changed then i could fix it maybe..
i did sudo rmmod psmouse and then sudo modprobe psmouse that did not work.
i have tried that with the config and nautilus thingy no changes.
then you're going to have to write configs to X for your touchpad driver, yeah it sucks =\
do you know where i can read about that so i know what to add etc.. beacuse i have no clue.
try the !touchpad or !mouse commands to ubuntu, and look for your device on the ubuntu forums
thanks
